## Discussion

If the user is authorized to access the document’s data, this property contains an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKCDADocument] object representing that data. Otherwise, it is set to `nil`.

The user is asked to authorize each CDA document the first time that document is returned by an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKDocumentQuery] query. The user can change the access permissions in the Health app.

For samples returned by an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSampleQuery] or an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAnchoredObjectQuery], this property is always set to `nil`. To access the document’s data from these samples, create a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKDocumentQuery] query for the sample’s UUID.

# document

**Instance Property**

The CDA document.

## Declaration

```swift
var document: HKCDADocument? { get }
```

## Discussion

If the user is authorized to access the document’s data, this property contains an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKCDADocument] object representing that data. Otherwise, it is set to `nil`.

The user is asked to authorize each CDA document the first time that document is returned by an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKDocumentQuery] query. The user can change the access permissions in the Health app.

For samples returned by an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSampleQuery] or an [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAnchoredObjectQuery], this property is always set to `nil`. To access the document’s data from these samples, create a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKDocumentQuery] query for the sample’s UUID.

## Accessing the Document

- **HKCDADocument**: An object representing a Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) document in HealthKit.
